title: 4C/ID Model-Based Virtual Patient (VP) Design Process for Dental Education: Enhancing Clinical Communication and Patient Record Analysis (Integrating Medical Language Proficiency)

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of advanced coursework and extensive professional field experience, basic **language proficiency** (grammar/vocabulary) for **medical record documentation** and **patient counseling**
context.additional_context: Strengthening clinical judgment and problem-solving skills through virtual patient simulation using personal devices, with a focus on enhancing language-based clinical competencies such as **patient symptom documentation**, **medical report writing**, and **medical terminology usage**. Includes comprehensive language proficiency diagnostics via **writing** and **reading comprehension** assessments

learning_goals: Learners systematically apply diagnostic and treatment procedures required in dental clinical scenarios through virtual patient simulations and develop **medical text comprehension** skills to accurately interpret patient symptom descriptions.

Learners make appropriate clinical decisions in response to various clinical case variations, accurately utilizing **specialized vocabulary** and **medical grammar** when documenting patient records and medical reports.

Learners identify and correct cognitive errors using a virtual patient feedback system through self-directed learning, refining **effective communication strategies** and **interpersonal communication skills** between patients and physicians.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
